task.summary: Start of a Windows Desktop Image File Renamer. Read EXIF Metadata on images. This will then move the files to a desired location with a Year/Month Folder structre and File name :YYYY_MM_DD-HH_MM_SSJPG o or something similar.

- Project structure cleanup - Added ExifLogic.cs as a dedicated class for EXIF metadata handling. - Kept MainWindow.xaml.cs focused on UI and event wiring. - Core functionality - Implemented EXIF DateTaken extraction using MetadataExtractor. - Renamed files to yyyyMMdd_HHmmss.jpg format. - Organized photos into Year/Month folder hierarchy. - Added duplicate handling (_1, _2, etc.) for identical timestamps. - UI improvements - Integrated folder picker via Microsoft.WindowsAPICodePack.Dialogs.CommonOpenFileDialog for source/target selection. - Added status text updates for user feedback. - Converted UI to dark mode (custom background, button styles, text colors). - Stability fixes - Removed InitializeComponent from helper class. - Resolved namespace ambiguities (System.IO.Directory, System.IO.Path). - Cleaned up string interpolation for safe filename generation. âœ… Tested successfully against sample JPGs â€” photos renamed and organized correctly.

Universal extension + metadata fallback support
- Added support for all file types (images, HEIC, MOV, MP4, RAW). - Implemented layered fallback: EXIF â†’ QuickTime/MP4/HEIC tags â†’ LastWriteTime â†’ CreationTime. - Applied `_noexif` suffix when metadata unavailable. - Replaced duplicate handling dropdown with radio buttons (Append, Skip, Overwrite). - Display selected source/target paths under buttons. - Improved dark mode readability across UI. - Added progress bar + counter with live updates. - Clarified namespaces with IO alias, improved error handling for stability.

UI transparency + preview enhancements
- Added "Show Rules" button with popup explaining renaming logic. - Implemented live preview panel next to duplicate handling options. - Centered source/target paths, progress counter, and status text. - Fixed initialization crash by moving UpdatePreview() to Loaded event. - Applied border styling for preview panel, improved dark mode readability. - Cleaned up using directives and maintained separation of UI vs. metadata logic.

feat: add custom variable support with validation + UX polish
- Integrated custom variable parsing into ExifLogic (supports {year}, {month}, {day}, {hour}, {minute}, {second}, {suffix}, {ext}, {counter}) - Added validation in MainWindow to detect invalid variables (e.g. {potato}) before processing - Implemented warning dialog: informs user of invalid variables, lists valid ones, explains fallback to default template, and offers choice to proceed or cancel - Updated presets in naming convention dropdown for consistency (yyyyMMdd_HHmmss, yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss, yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss) - Increased window height to 525px to prevent clipping when custom textbox is shown - Improved preview logic to reflect both presets and custom variables - Enhanced error handling and user messaging for clarity and transparency

feat: add custom variable support with validation + UX polish
- Integrated custom variable parsing into ExifLogic (supports {year}, {month}, {day}, {hour}, {minute}, {second}, {suffix}, {ext}, {counter}) - Added validation in MainWindow to detect invalid variables (e.g. {potato}) before processing - Implemented warning dialog: informs user of invalid variables, lists valid ones, explains fallback to default template, and offers choice to proceed or cancel - Updated presets in naming convention dropdown for consistency (yyyyMMdd_HHmmss, yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss, yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss) - Increased window height to 525px to prevent clipping when custom textbox is shown - Improved preview logic to reflect both presets and custom variables - Enhanced error handling and user messaging for clarity and transparency

feat: add custom variable support with validation + UX polish
- Integrated custom variable parsing into ExifLogic (supports {year}, {month}, {day}, {hour}, {minute}, {second}, {suffix}, {ext}, {counter}) - Added validation in MainWindow to detect invalid variables (e.g. {potato}) before processing - Implemented warning dialog: informs user of invalid variables, lists valid ones, explains fallback to default template, and offers choice to proceed or cancel - Updated presets in naming convention dropdown for consistency (yyyyMMdd_HHmmss, yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss, yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss) - Increased window height to 525px to prevent clipping when custom textbox is shown - Improved preview logic to reflect both presets and custom variables - Enhanced error handling and user messaging for clarity and transparency

chore: finalize custom variable validation + prep roadmap features
- Completed integration of custom variable parsing and validation with user-facing warnings - Added UX polish: invalid variables trigger a warning dialog with proceed/cancel choice - Updated presets for consistency (yyyyMMdd_HHmmss, yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss, yyyy_MM_dd_HH_mm_ss) - Increased window height to 525px to prevent clipping when custom textbox expands - Improved preview logic to reflect presets and custom variables - Established roadmap for next features: â€¢ Live validation in preview (highlight invalid variables immediately) â€¢ Saved presets (JSON-backed, reusable formats with "Save as preset" button) â€¢ Batch dryâ€‘run mode (Preview All button beside Organize) â€¢ Logging/report output (incremental logs in /Log folder with datetime filenames)

feat: add live validation marker for custom variables
- Introduced âš marker beside custom format textbox to highlight invalid variables in real time - Tooltip displays specific invalid variables and lists all valid options ({year}, {month}, {day}, {hour}, {minute}, {second}, {suffix}, {ext}, {counter}) - Updated XAML layout: marker + textbox grouped in horizontal panel for clean alignment - Preview logic enhanced to dynamically show/hide marker based on validation results - Preserved uncluttered preview area by moving warnings into marker tooltip instead of preview text - Added Preview All button placeholder beside Organize Photos for future dry-run mode

ðŸ“œ Commit Log (Current Round) Commit Title:
Summary of Changes: â€¢ Fixed scope issue in . â€¢ Implemented duplicate handling simulation in preview: â€¢ Append counter â€¢ Skip duplicate â€¢ Overwrite existing â€¢ Added guards for extensionâ€‘less files in preview logic (partial fix). â€¢ Integrated audit log writing for transparency of rename operations. â€¢ Stressâ€‘tested with 12k+ files â€” confirmed performance and stability. â€¢ Improved progress bar updates during preview generation. Impact: â€¢ Users can now dryâ€‘run renames with full visibility of duplicate handling. â€¢ Audit log provides a permanent record of operations. â€¢ Large batches run quickly without choking the UI or system.
Revised Readme. Few more items need to be added. screenshots and update status of pending features and fixes.

Side quest: polished app branding with a shiny icon Sometimes itâ€™s the little things that make a project feel complete. We took a detour to design and integrate a custom photoâ€‘calendar icon, converted it into a multiâ€‘size bundle, and wired it up so Windows shows it everywhere â€” Explorer, taskbar, and the window title bar. Along the way we wrangled path mismatches, clarified WPF vs. WinUI interop, and cleaned up unnecessary package references. The result: our Image File Renamer now has a professional face to match its powerful internals. A small change, but it makes the app feel like a product instead of just a utility. ðŸŒˆâœ¨

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/main'
Updated Readme.md Roadmap with current status for completed items.
